response:
Young woman with subacute optic neuritis and cervical myelitis suggests an inflammatory demyelinating disorder; MS most likely, with MOGAD and NMOSD important alternatives. Structural cervical cord disease and metabolic/infectious myelopathies are less likely but need exclusion.

differential_diagnosis = ["Relapsing-Remitting Multiple Sclerosis", "Myelin Oligodendrocyte Glycoprotein Antibody-Associated Disease (MOGAD)", "Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (AQP4-IgG positive)", "Cervical spinal cord compression (C5\u2013C6 disc herniation or tumor)", "Infectious myelitis (HSV/VZV/HIV/Syphilis)", "Vitamin B12 deficiency (Subacute Combined Degeneration)", "Spinal cord infarction"]
